botanical_details.genus: Fuchsia can be deciduous or evergreen shrubs or trees, rarely perennials, with opposite or whorled leaves and usually pendent flowers with conspicuous tubular calyx, 4 spreading sepals and 4 erect petals

how_to_grow.cultivation: Ideal for growing under glass or in containers that can be brought indoors to overwinter. how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown in spring, by softwood cuttings in spring or by semi-hardwood cuttings in late summer
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, whiteflies, vine weevils, capsid bugs and red spider mites
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to fuchsia rust and grey moulds moulds and rust diseases
